body:

Close #579

Rename original `rewrite` to `rewrite_td`.

Make `CthresholdUnproven::with_polynomial` failable (check polynomial bytes size against children count and k).

title: Add {set_exports} script for {ergo-lib-wasm}
body:
When {wasm-pack} is run with browser target, it generates a {package.json} in which there is a {module} field, but no {main}, {type} or {exports} field is present. This causes some of the modern tools which run in Node be unable to use the package (Vitest is an example).

Although it may seem irrational to use the browser package in Node, but it makes sense when we want to write tests. Many test tools such as Jest and Vitest run in Node.

Add a {set_exports} script to be run after {wasm-pack}, updating the generated {package.json} as follows:
- Add an {exports} field to enable new Node entry resolution feature
- Add {"type": "module"} to indicate that this is an ESM module
- Remove {module}, as it's no longer needed

{wasm-pack} may fix the issue in the future or new module entry resolution mechanisms may be introduced in the future. Until then, this script will enable the use of the package without getting browser environment related issues when run in Node.

Related {wasm-pack} PR:
https://github.com/rustwasm/wasm-pack/pull/1061

Closes #632.

title: fix RNG panic in electron/vue on desktop
body:
trace:
```
panicked at 'could not initialize thread_rng: Node.js crypto module is unavailable', /home/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/rand-0.8.5/src/rngs/thread.rs:72:17

Stack:

Error
    at __wbg_new_693216e109162396 (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/ergo-lib-wasm-browser/ergo_lib_wasm_bg.js:6914:17)
    at console_error_panic_hook::hook::h992992de3f0fa9b9 (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[1812]:0x198005)
    at core::ops::function::Fn::call::hc810e5369804b9f1 (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[10901]:0x29a677)
    at std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h1c368a27f9b0afe1 (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[2967]:0x1e955f)
    at std::panicking::begin_panic_handler::{{closure}}::h8e1f8b682ca33009 (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[4676]:0x236ce4)
    at std::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_end_short_backtrace::h7f7da41799766719 (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[9950]:0x2973b2)
    at rust_begin_unwind (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[7859]:0x281b8c)
    at core::panicking::panic_fmt::hcdb13a4b2416cf82 (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[7922]:0x2829f3)
    at std::thread::local::lazy::LazyKeyInner<T>::initialize::hc4dfa70367192fbc (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[1709]:0x18ea94)
    at rand::rngs::thread::THREAD_RNG_KEY::__getit::h8a182064bee393d6 (wasm://wasm/00ffe776:wasm-function[9567]:0x295009)
```

Fix:
> Looks like this https://github.com/rust-random/getrandom/issues/256#issuecomment-1152904556 works 🥳 
> still running some tests but that seems to be the solution for us. Using browser wasm version and adding the at the end of the bindings file

Even better fix:
Figure out why `cardano-serialization-lib` JS bindings work and use the same approach.

title: Check input coin preservation in TxBuilder, remove min_change_value
body:
Close #593

Done:
- remove `min_value_change` parameter in `TxBuilder` used to filter out change boxes.
- add check that all input coins cannot be less than all output coins. With existing `inputs < outputs` check we now have only one happy path `inputs == outputs`(coin preservation).

title: `TxBuilder` explicit token burn permission and token preservation
body:
Close #595

This PR adds a required explicit permit to burn tokens in `TxBuilder`. So that token burn can only occur with the caller's permission.
The caller, in order to allow token burn, need to call `TxBuilder.set_token_burn_permit(tokens)` and state the amount of tokens allowed to be burned. The checks for token preservation are added in `TxBuilder::build()` so that `input token + minted token - permitted burned tokens = output tokens` always holds. Moreover, if the output boxes burn fewer tokens than was asked in a permit, an error is raised as well.
Besides that, `TxBuilderError` errors become more specific and precise, with all generic errors lacking context gone (`TokenAmountError`, `BoxValueError`, etc.).

title: Fix for #590 accidental token burn in change box
Fix `peer_discovery` on Chrome
body:
Close #581

Summary of changes:
 - Implemented a chrome-specific version of `peer_discovery`, as well as an incremental version that remembers the results from previous calls. A drawback of the incremental version is that no matter how small the sub-task, there's always an 80 second wait time at the end to make sure the preflight requests are relinquished by Chrome. I could give an option to return early, but the end user needs to be careful to not eat up all the requests.
 - Made an improvement to the `reqwest` timeouts for WASM, where if the HTTP request is successful, the associated timeout is cancelled.
 - The JS browser tests now use `peer_discovery`, so no more hard-coded node addresses. The tests are quite lengthy though; the incremental `peer_discovery` test is about 8 minutes.

title: Add ergo-merkle-tree
body:
Hi, here is my first draft for ergo-merkle-tree, I've not added C/Swift bindings yet since there's some design decisions I'd like to get ironed out/approved beforehand.

Some thoughts:

- Right now, the only accepted hash for MerkleProof is 32 bytes long, same with leaf data. Trying to create a MerkleProof with any other size returns an error.  Should this instead be dynamic to accommodate any size hash/data?

- MerkleProof.leaf_data could be a borrowed slice, but I decided to make it an owned array since that makes it a bit easier to write bindings for since there's no lifetimes to deal with, another way would also be to not have the leaf data be part of the proof at all but instead have MerkleProof::valid's signature be:
```rust 
fn valid(&self, leaf_data: &[u8], expected_root: &[u8]) -> bool
```
but this approach would have a disadvantage since we wouldn't be able to directly deserialize the MerkleProof from JSON (see: tests/block_proof)

- Finally, I've added a prefixed_hash function to lib.rs, do you think it would be a better fit for the sigma-util crate instead (If there is some utility for it in other parts of ergo)?

title: Draft the REST API for SPV client for Rust <-> C FFI <-> Swift and Wasm
body:
Ref #510 

This PR drafts the async API for long-running tasks for the SPV node API with timeout and task cancellation support.

### Wasm
Rust futures exposed as JS futures and underlying `reqwest` implementation for Wasm target using browser's Fetch API.

### C/Swift
Swift API is built on passing user's closures as callbacks to be called on task completion. 
The call flow with under-the-hood implementation looks like this:
- Wrap user's closure to convert the result from C types to Swift types and increment its reference count. See [WrapClosure.swift](https://github.com/ergoplatform/sigma-rust/blob/92fb1e3a3b7e440734bb08b7b1f1502c8fb646b3/bindings/ergo-lib-ios/Sources/ErgoLib/WrapClosure.swift#L12-L57)
- In `ergo-lib-c-core` make a Rust Future calling `ergo-rest` `async` API and wrap it in `Abortable` returning abort handle. See [abortable.rs](https://github.com/ergoplatform/sigma-rust/blob/92fb1e3a3b7e440734bb08b7b1f1502c8fb646b3/bindings/ergo-lib-c-core/src/rest/api/node/abortable.rs#L7-L19) 
- In case of task cancellation (called `RequestHandle::abort`) besides aborting the task calls for user's closure release on the Swift side via [`CompletionCallback::callback_release`](https://github.com/ergoplatform/sigma-rust/blob/92fb1e3a3b7e440734bb08b7b1f1502c8fb646b3/bindings/ergo-lib-ios/Sources/ErgoLib/WrapClosure.swift#L46-L53)

From the perspective of extending the C/Swift API with new tasks the developer's workflow should be the following:
- Add `ergo-lib-c-core` function similar to 
https://github.com/ergoplatform/sigma-rust/blob/92fb1e3a3b7e440734bb08b7b1f1502c8fb646b3/bindings/ergo-lib-c-core/src/rest/api/node.rs#L17-L35
- Wrap it in Swift similar to https://github.com/ergoplatform/sigma-rust/blob/92fb1e3a3b7e440734bb08b7b1f1502c8fb646b3/bindings/ergo-lib-ios/Sources/ErgoLib/RestNodeApi.swift#L20-L32

### Misc
This PR moves some types from ergotree-ir and ergo-lib crates to ergo-chain-types crate.

I have some questions:
